subject: Re: [junit] Hi I am getting failure test case even though i have correct exp and act  value
msgSnippet: Hi Friends, Thanks for your immediate response.. Act, I done one mistake in my code.. List  list1 = new ArrayList(); List list2 = new ArrayList(); List
messageBody:
Hi Friends,

Thanks for your immediate response..

Act, I done one mistake in my code..

List list1 = new ArrayList();

List list2 = new ArrayList();

List finalList = new ArrayList();

// act i want append the list1 data to finalList as collection not as object same //case for list2

// the problem happen from here only ..
finalList.add(list1);
finalList.add(list2);

// In the finalList content should not be list of list according my requirement ..

// so I changed in the following way ,,so it will append the data to finalList
finalList.addAll(list1);
finalList.addAll(list2);

// when are u using sop(finalList) for both the case output could be same ..

Once gain thx u guys....

Have a good day and Have nice weekend

With Regards,
Subramanain T
India.

Robert Wenner <robert.wenner@...> wrote: Hi,

> but my expected and actaul are same...

Same or equal? Which do you want?
What do you use, assertSame or assertEquals?

> The expected and actaul class inside have list (collection of another
> class).

What do you get when you call the equals method manually, e.g.,
is.equals(expected)? (Or is == expected, whatever you are interested in.)

Assuming you want equals -- did you overwrite boolean equals(Object)?

Good luck,

Robert

PS: my spam filter classified your email as spam; you may get more answers
if your email does not look like spam.
